6090eb27ee9d652a7d2d8273ca6321ea (15:52): unstable: here it is .. am using etch
d58eb57e8485abedb5b04c6548cc81e1 (15:52): tenzing_, try doing an apt-get update, then apt-get dist-upgrade, then try again. your system seems to be a bit out-of-date.
9c20f9f5098b0268828528c2c746f37d (15:53): yea, this seems like a good idea to do apt-get update && apt-get dist-upgrade
6090eb27ee9d652a7d2d8273ca6321ea (15:53): Eulex: thanks ... .. and is my sources.list file ok
9c20f9f5098b0268828528c2c746f37d (15:53): tenzing_: You should also have a security line in your sources.list for security patches
d58eb57e8485abedb5b04c6548cc81e1 (15:54): unstable, he has, but it's commented out
d58eb57e8485abedb5b04c6548cc81e1 (15:54): I'd uncomment the deb-src line too
9c20f9f5098b0268828528c2c746f37d (15:54): tenzing_: uncomment that
6090eb27ee9d652a7d2d8273ca6321ea (15:54): unstable: Eulex .. ok
9c20f9f5098b0268828528c2c746f37d (15:55): tenzing_: Tell us when apt-get update && apt-get dist-upgrade is done; after it is, try apt-get install libsdl1.2-dev; again
6090eb27ee9d652a7d2d8273ca6321ea (15:56): unstable: ok , will do that ... and if i again get some errors .. i will contact u guys
6090eb27ee9d652a7d2d8273ca6321ea (16:00): unstable, Eulex  i think apt-get dist-upgrade will take me days  :)
9c20f9f5098b0268828528c2c746f37d (16:01): tenzing_: What country are you from?
d58eb57e8485abedb5b04c6548cc81e1 (16:01): tenzing_, hehe, yeah, that's what I suspected :)
6090eb27ee9d652a7d2d8273ca6321ea (16:01): unstable: from Bhutan ...
9c20f9f5098b0268828528c2c746f37d (16:02): tenzing_: You are using an american mirror.
9c20f9f5098b0268828528c2c746f37d (16:02): tenzing_: You might be much better off to use a mirror closer to your location. ie china
6090eb27ee9d652a7d2d8273ca6321ea (16:03): unstable:  how do i do that?
9c20f9f5098b0268828528c2c746f37d (16:03): http://www.debian.org/mirror/list
6090eb27ee9d652a7d2d8273ca6321ea (16:03): change in sources.list/
9c20f9f5098b0268828528c2c746f37d (16:03): Go to the mirror list, and pick one, then change your sources.list yes
9c20f9f5098b0268828528c2c746f37d (16:03): tenzing_: There are programs that automatically do it for you.
9c20f9f5098b0268828528c2c746f37d (16:03): tenzing_: apt-get install netselect
6090eb27ee9d652a7d2d8273ca6321ea (16:04): unstable: ok ... so netselect does that?
d58eb57e8485abedb5b04c6548cc81e1 (16:04): apt-spy can do it too
9c20f9f5098b0268828528c2c746f37d (16:04): tenzing_: It will basically take a continent(you chose) and try to download from each mirror, then pick the fastest one
9c20f9f5098b0268828528c2c746f37d (16:04): tenzing_: This will increase your download speeds very significantly I believe
9c20f9f5098b0268828528c2c746f37d (16:04): At least your download speeds with apt-get
6090eb27ee9d652a7d2d8273ca6321ea (16:05): unstable, Eulex .. ok
d58eb57e8485abedb5b04c6548cc81e1 (16:05): apt-spy seems more suited for the job; netselect is a more flexible tool that you probably have to setup quite a bit
6090eb27ee9d652a7d2d8273ca6321ea (16:06): may be i can use the mirror at hongkong

9c20f9f5098b0268828528c2c746f37d (16:06): tenzing_: yea if you don't want to use apt-spy or netselect, you can just pick one. You probably know best out of all of us, which areas you have strong routing to.
9c20f9f5098b0268828528c2c746f37d (16:07): tenzing_: apt-get install apt-spy
9c20f9f5098b0268828528c2c746f37d (16:08): tenzing_: cancel your other downloads with apt-get; then apt-get install apt-spy
6090eb27ee9d652a7d2d8273ca6321ea (16:08): unstable:  ok .. am doing it rite now
9c20f9f5098b0268828528c2c746f37d (16:08): apt-spy -a Asia -d testing
9c20f9f5098b0268828528c2c746f37d (16:08): tenzing_: Then type that.
6090eb27ee9d652a7d2d8273ca6321ea (16:09): unstable: ok
9c20f9f5098b0268828528c2c746f37d (16:10): tenzing_: You aren't getting any warnings about gpg keys are you?
6090eb27ee9d652a7d2d8273ca6321ea (16:10): no .. but am getting errors like this
6090eb27ee9d652a7d2d8273ca6321ea (16:10): SERVER: debian.cn99.com
6090eb27ee9d652a7d2d8273ca6321ea (16:10): Benchmarking FTP...
6090eb27ee9d652a7d2d8273ca6321ea (16:10): Error: a timeout was reached
9c20f9f5098b0268828528c2c746f37d (16:11): That just means one of the servers on the list is down, or non-routable
6090eb27ee9d652a7d2d8273ca6321ea (16:12): unstable: so apt-spy will choose the closest mirror for me and then change my sources.list file?
9c20f9f5098b0268828528c2c746f37d (16:13): tenzing_: Not necessarily the closest, but the fastest out of the list it has.
9c20f9f5098b0268828528c2c746f37d (16:13): tenzing_: yes though
6090eb27ee9d652a7d2d8273ca6321ea (16:13): ok .. that sounds nice ...
9c20f9f5098b0268828528c2c746f37d (16:14): lyre.mit.edu is the fastest mirror out of any mirror on debian's list for me.
9c20f9f5098b0268828528c2c746f37d (16:15): I can get 4 megs a second from it sometimes
6090eb27ee9d652a7d2d8273ca6321ea (16:17): wow ... thats great ..
6090eb27ee9d652a7d2d8273ca6321ea (16:17): but to tell you the truth ... i was unaware of all this
6090eb27ee9d652a7d2d8273ca6321ea (16:17): unstable: so are u in the US?

d58eb57e8485abedb5b04c6548cc81e1 (16:18): Benchmarking FTP...
d58eb57e8485abedb5b04c6548cc81e1 (16:18): Error: RETR response: 550

d58eb57e8485abedb5b04c6548cc81e1 (16:20): bug found: http://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=356654 :)
d58eb57e8485abedb5b04c6548cc81e1 (16:21): tenzing_, try 'apt-spy -a Asia -d testing -f ls-lR.gz' instead
9c20f9f5098b0268828528c2c746f37d (16:30): tenzing_: How is it going; did it finish yet?
6090eb27ee9d652a7d2d8273ca6321ea (16:31): unstable: no it didnt ....
6090eb27ee9d652a7d2d8273ca6321ea (16:31): it is showing a maximum of 3.02 kB/sec from ftp.iitm.ac.in till now ... think it is in india
9c20f9f5098b0268828528c2c746f37d (16:34): tenzing_: Is that fast for you?
9c20f9f5098b0268828528c2c746f37d (16:34): Is that better then the american mirro?
6090eb27ee9d652a7d2d8273ca6321ea (16:35): apt-spy is still running ...
6090eb27ee9d652a7d2d8273ca6321ea (16:36): unstable: am using a 256k line shared with some 50 ppl
9c20f9f5098b0268828528c2c746f37d (16:37): tenzing_: After this is all over and done with, try and do apt-get update && apt-get dist-upgrade every week or so
9c20f9f5098b0268828528c2c746f37d (16:37): So it doesn't build up that much.
9c20f9f5098b0268828528c2c746f37d (16:37): Debian developers maintain packages, and are always uploading new version(in testing/unstable)
9c20f9f5098b0268828528c2c746f37d (16:37): So the longer you wait, the more it builds up.
6090eb27ee9d652a7d2d8273ca6321ea (16:38): unstable: ok ..
d58eb57e8485abedb5b04c6548cc81e1 (16:50): tenzing_, you may want to check out cron-apt. and anacron if your box is not always on.

d58eb57e8485abedb5b04c6548cc81e1 (16:52): cron-apt schedules downloading of packages at a specific time in the middle of the night. anacron makes sure that it won't miss cron entries (like cron-apt) if the computer is not turned on at that moment.
6090eb27ee9d652a7d2d8273ca6321ea (16:53): Eulex: ok .. will look into that ...
6090eb27ee9d652a7d2d8273ca6321ea (16:53): unstable:, Eulex , at the moment apt-spy has finished and am running apt-get update
d58eb57e8485abedb5b04c6548cc81e1 (16:54): tenzing_, if you're sharing the line with 50 ppl, it might be adventageous to make it download the packages in the middle of the night
6090eb27ee9d652a7d2d8273ca6321ea (16:55): Eulex: ok ... i usually have to keep the box on for the nite when i have to doenload something big
d58eb57e8485abedb5b04c6548cc81e1 (16:56): cron-apt will automate the downloading too, so that you usually will have all packages you need to upgrade already downloaded when you dist-upgrade
